summary: The bill, officially named the Teenagers Earning Everyday Necessary Skills Act (TEENS Act), aims to amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938. It proposes to expand the working hours for employees aged 14 to 16 during the school year. The bill stipulates that such employees can work up to 24 hours per week when school is in session, starting no earlier than 7:00 a.m. and ending no later than 9:00 p.m., without being considered oppressive child labor.
